content: Just wanted to share with the Backdrop community about very interesting things happening these days in Russia. That poor (in every respect) country has been in a deep socioeconomic crisis, and that's mainly because of Putin's regime corruption. But there is finally a hope that things there could change sooner than it seemed. If you wonder then just watch the new movie called "Putin's palace. History of world's largest bribe": YouTube - YouTube
Also try to watch this one YouTube - YouTube Both videos are in Russian language, but follow the English subtitles.
I've always liked Vladimir Putin - Putin, Putout :sweat_smile:
More than 20 years this bloody clown make troubles for my first name.

findlabnet(Vladimir) said:

More than 20 years this bloody clown make troubles for my first name.

Каждый раз когда пересекаюсь с русскоязычным человеком, я опасаюсь разочароваться обнаружив в человеке ватника с промотыми мозгами о богоизбранной особенности, духовных скрепах и праве быть хамом с открытом забралом лезящем кошмарить других, даже самый близкий родной славянский украинский народ. Рад что в этот раз этого не случилось.

I guess Trump has been stealing Putin's thunder these past 4 years ...the combination of stupidity + corruption seems to overshadow plain corruption :shrug: (PS: is this thread becoming too political and risking breaching the community CoC?)

klonos said:

I guess Trump has been stealing Putin's thunder these past 4 years ...the combination of stupidity + corruption seems to overshadow plain corruption :shrug: (PS: is this thread becoming too political and risking breaching the community CoC?)

Oh, I should lookup for CoC, didn't know we have something like that. When initiating this topic, I had just noticed "A place to talk about what is happening in our lives outside of Backdrop." And then it's not we who coined such expressions like "Putin's puppet" and "Putin's puppy". Man, I'm so glad Orangutrump is finally gone.
Takes some bravery for Navalny to willingly risk prison. Hopefully it changes things

Herb said:

Takes some bravery for Navalny to willingly risk prison. Hopefully it changes things

Especially in a mafia state with terrible penitentiary system.

Judging from the comments, I think hardly anybody really knows what's going on. Unless you're on Telegram or some other alternative news source, there is no way to know what's actually happening. All mainstream media is totally corrupt. The world will be surprised and shocked to learn the underlying progression of recent events.
